leetcode.title: Two Sum
leetcode.description: Given an array of integers nums and an integer target, return indices of the two numbers such that they add up to target.

leetcode.title: Add Two Numbers
leetcode.description: You are given two non-empty linked lists representing two non-negative integers. The digits are stored in reverse order, and each of their nodes contains a single digit. Add the two numbers and return the sum as a linked list.

leetcode.title: Longest Substring Without Repeating Characters
leetcode.description: Given a string s, find the length of the longest substring without repeating characters.

leetcode.title: Median of Two Sorted Arrays
leetcode.description: Given two sorted arrays nums1 and nums2 of size m and n respectively, return the median of the two sorted arrays.

leetcode.title: Longest Palindromic Substring
leetcode.description: Given a string s, return the longest palindromic substring in s.

leetcode.title: Valid Parentheses
leetcode.description: Given a string s containing just the characters '(', ')', '{', '}', '[' and ']', determine if the input string is valid.

leetcode.title: Remove Duplicates from Sorted Array
leetcode.description: Given an integer array nums sorted in non-decreasing order, remove the duplicates in-place such that each unique element appears only once.

leetcode.title: Merge Two Sorted Lists
leetcode.description: You are given the heads of two sorted linked lists list1 and list2. Merge the two lists in a one sorted list.

leetcode.title: Binary Tree Level Order Traversal
leetcode.description: Given the root of a binary tree, return the level order traversal of its nodes' values. (i.e., from left to right, level by level).

leetcode.title: Word Search
leetcode.description: Given an m x n grid of characters board and a string word, return true if word exists in the grid.

leetcode.title: Trapping Rain Water
leetcode.description: Given n non-negative integers representing an elevation map where the width of each bar is 1, compute how much water it can trap after raining.

leetcode.title: Merge k Sorted Lists
leetcode.description: You are given an array of k linked-lists lists, each linked-list is sorted in ascending order. Merge all the linked-lists into one sorted linked-list and return it.

hackerrank.title: Solve Me First
hackerrank.description: Complete the function solveMeFirst to compute the sum of two integers.

hackerrank.title: Simple Array Sum
hackerrank.description: Given an array of integers, find the sum of its elements.

hackerrank.title: Compare the Triplets
hackerrank.description: Alice and Bob each created one problem for HackerRank. A reviewer rates the two challenges, awarding points on a scale from 1 to 100 for three categories: problem clarity, originality, and difficulty.

hackerrank.title: A Very Big Sum
hackerrank.description: Calculate and print the sum of the elements in an array, keeping in mind that some of those integers may be quite large.

hackerrank.title: Diagonal Difference
hackerrank.description: Given a square matrix, calculate the absolute difference between the sums of its diagonals.

hackerrank.title: Birthday Cake Candles
hackerrank.description: You are in charge of the cake for a child's birthday. You have decided the cake will have one candle for each year of their total age. They will only be able to blow out the tallest of the candles. Count how many candles are tallest.

hackerrank.title: Matrix Layer Rotation
hackerrank.description: You are given a 2D matrix of dimension MxN and a positive integer R. You have to rotate the matrix R times and print the resultant matrix.

hackerrank.title: The Time in Words
hackerrank.description: Given the time in numerals we may convert it into words.

hackerrank.title: Forming a Magic Square
hackerrank.description: We define a magic square to be an n×n matrix of distinct positive integers from 1 to n^2 where the sum of any row, column, or diagonal is always equal to the same number.

hackerrank.title: Journey to the Moon
hackerrank.description: The member states of the UN are planning to send people to the moon. They want them to be from different countries. You will be given a list of pairs of astronaut ID's. Each pair is made of astronauts from the same country. Determine how many pairs of astronauts from different countries they can choose from.

hackerrank.title: Sherlock and the Valid String
hackerrank.description: Sherlock considers a string to be valid if all characters of the string appear the same number of times. It is also valid if he can remove just 1 character at 1 index in the string, and the remaining characters will occur the same number of times.

hackerrank.title: The Bomberman Game
hackerrank.description: Bomberman lives in a rectangular grid. Each cell in the grid either contains a bomb or nothing at all. Each bomb can be planted in any cell of the grid but once planted, it will detonate after exactly 3 seconds. Once a bomb detonates, it destroys all adjacent cells.
